title: 110_s3160
content: The Act is titled the "National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2008". References in the Act are considered to be made to the National Sea Grant College Program Act. The Act includes findings and purpose statements. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2008 amends Section 202(a) to encourage the development of coastal hazard systems, understand global environmental processes, and utilize the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for commitment and engagement. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2008 aims to promote integrated research, education, training, and extension services for the understanding, assessment, development, management, and conservation of ocean, coastal, and Great Lakes resources through Federal support of programs and projects by sea grant colleges and institutes. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2008 focuses on promoting integrated research, education, training, and extension services for ocean, coastal, and Great Lakes resources. Section 202 is amended to replace "utilization" with "management". SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Section 203 (33 U.S.C. 1122) is amended to update definitions, including changing "utilization" to "management" and "advisory services" to "extension services". Additionally, a new definition for "regional research and information plan" is added. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Program Elements of the national sea grant college program network, including international projects, administration, and strategic investments in ocean, coastal, and Great Lakes resources. Amendments are made to the Program Elements of the national sea grant college program network, including changes to the functions of the Director. Amendments to the national sea grant college program network include encouraging collaborations among sea grant colleges and institutes to address regional and national priorities. SEC. 6 amends Section 205 to include the Nation in grants and limits the total amount for grants. SEC. 7 amends Section 207 to change "advisory services" to "extension services". SEC. 8 pertains to fellowships. SEC. 8 amends Section 208(a) regarding fellowships, changing the reporting frequency and federal cost share requirements. The Sea Grant Review Panel is redesignated as the National Sea Grant Advisory Board, with current members allowed to continue serving until their term expires. Any references to the previous panel are now references to the new Advisory Board. The Sea Grant Review Panel is now the National Sea Grant Advisory Board, with current members able to serve until their term ends. Section 209 (33 U.S.C. 1128) is amended by removing preceding text and inserting new language. The National Sea Grant Advisory Board, previously known as the Sea Grant Review Panel, has current members serving until their term ends. Section 209 (33 U.S.C. 1128) has been amended with new language. The National Sea Grant Advisory Board, formerly the Sea Grant Review Panel, is established as an independent committee. Various sections are amended to replace "panel" with "Board." The Board's duties include advising the Secretary and Director. The National Sea Grant Advisory Board advises the Secretary and Director on utilizing the sea grant college program, designating sea grant colleges and institutes, and other matters referred by the Secretary. The Board reports to Congress biennially on the program's progress towards meeting national priorities. The National Sea Grant Advisory Board advises the Secretary and Director on the sea grant college program. The Board's membership, terms, and powers are amended, including the extension of voting members' terms. Subcommittees may be established under the Board. The National Sea Grant Advisory Board may establish subcommittees to fulfill its duties, including individuals who are not Board members. SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 212 of the National Sea Grant College Program Act is amended to authorize appropriations to the Secretary for fiscal years 2009 to 2014. Subsection (a)(2) is modified to focus on the biology, prevention, and control of aquatic issues. Section 212 of the National Sea Grant College Program Act is amended to authorize appropriations to the Secretary for fiscal years 2009 to 2014, focusing on the biology, prevention, and control of aquatic issues. Amendments include changes to subsections regarding blooms and performance assessments, as well as regional or national strategic investments. SEC. 11. REPEAL OF ANNUAL COORDINATION REPORT REQUIREMENT. Section 9 of the National Sea Grant College Program Act Amendments of 2002 (33 U.S.C. 857-20) is repealed.
